snippet: The scathing report, which took five years to produce, is a sweeping indictment of the C.I.A. interrogation program carried out in secret prisons after the Sept. 11 attacks.
abstract: Senate Intelligence Committee releases harsh report of Central Intelligence Agency's program to detain and interrogate terrorism suspects after Sept 11 attacks; charges that CIA tactics were more brutal and less effective than agency stated to Bush administration officials or to public; CIA severely criticizes report, though it is welcomed by Pres Obama.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo and Peter Baker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The scathing report, which took five years to produce, is a sweeping indictment of the C.I.A. interrogation program carried out in secret prisons after the Sept. 11 attacks.

headline.sub: Says Agency Deceived Congress and White House
headline.main: Panel Faults C.I.A. Over Brutality and Deceit in Terrorism Interrogations
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Faults C.I.A. Over Brutality and Deceit in Terrorism Interrogations
